Manage Audit Logs

All user activities on the PW EMS are logged and available for auditing through audit logs. You can use the audit log (containing audit trails) generated by PW EMS to view user-performed operations information, which includes the time these operations were performed, whether they were successful, and who performed them when they were logged into the system.

  1. In the navigation bar, click Audit Logs.
  2. In the Audit Logs window, view the automatically-generated user actions in their respective fields that need attention:

    Column

    Description
    User Displays the user ID who performed the operation for which the audit log was generated.
    Org Name

    Displays the Organization to which this user belongs.
    Date Displays the day, month, year, and time for when the operation was performed by the user.
    Method Displays what type of operation performed by the user. For example, logging in or logging out of the system.
    Category Displays the category of the operation performed by the user, which describes the type of operation. For example, the category for a user logging in or out would be Authorization.
    Details Displays detailed information about the user operation.
    Completion Status Displays whether the operation performed by the user was successful or failed.
    The following example shows various Administrator user operations that the PW EMS audited.
  3. Click EXPORT AUDIT LOGS if you want do download the audit logs to your web browser's default download location as an AuditLogs_<Date>.csv file.
  • Configure Audit Log Categories
    Use this task to select certain categories to filter audit logs that pertain to user operations.
